title: Man City boss Pep Guardiola's surprising assessment of Swansea clash - Manchester Evening News
text:
Sport Man City boss Pep Guardiola's surprising assessment of Swansea clash Manchester City will be hoping to close the gap on league leaders Chelsea when they take on Swansea at the Etihad in the Premier League. Manchester City have still got to play Manchester United , Liverpool, Arsenal and Chelsea - but Pep Guardiola believes the game against Swansea is one of the toughest left this season. 
Relegation-threatened Swansea sit 17th in the Premier League table but despite their position the Blues boss has been impressed with what he has seen. 
Swansea have won three from four since Paul Clement took over as manager last month, including a win against Liverpool at Anfield. 
And Guardiola admits he is troubled by what he has seen, saying: "I tried to discover the way to attack them and - wow - I couldn't find it. It's so complicated. 
"When I see their games I can see his hands on it it. They are so well organised. 
"There is no space in the middle. When you go and attack outside they defend really well in the box. Then they have long balls to the striker with Llorente. They have quality players for the counter attack. Read More Pep Guardiola explains how Gabriel Jesus and Sergio Aguero can form deadly Man City attack 
"It will be a really game, one of the toughest until the end of the season. 
"Now they are in a good moment, won three of the last four, but it is also the way they play. They won at Anfield and beat Southampton, big teams. 
"It will be really tough but hopefully we can win two in a row." 
City go in to the game 13 points behind league leaders Chelsea after they beat Arsenal. Read More
